abstract: Treasury Dept announces that roughly 50,000 taxpayers who already filed returns based on inaccurate data sent by HealthCare.gov will not have to refile; those affected will, however, be able to submit new returns if they expect updated data to generate a larger refund.
lead_paragraph: The Treasury Department said those who expected to pay less taxes after receiving corrected health insurance data could amend their filings, but it would not be mandatory.

headline.main: Erroneous HealthCare.gov Tax Forms Will Not Force Taxpayers to Resubmit Returns
headline.print_headline: Tax Form Error Will Not Force Resubmissions

snippet: The Treasury Department said those who expected to pay less taxes after receiving corrected health insurance data could amend their filings, but it would not be mandatory.
